channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How Democrats want to reform DHS — and why some Republicans are open to their demands
item.description: A spending agreement under consideration in the Senate would temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security while lawmakers negotiate provisions to rein in federal immigration agents.
item.content:encoded:
A spending agreement under consideration in the Senate would temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security while lawmakers negotiate provisions to rein in federal immigration agents.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: With his first Grammy nomination, Destin Conrad embraces personal evolution
item.description: Destin Conrad went from teen social media star to a musician touring the world on some of its biggest stages. In 2025, he put out both an R&B and jazz album and earned his first Grammy nomination.
item.content:encoded:
Destin Conrad went from teen social media star to a musician touring the world on some of its biggest stages. In 2025, he put out both an R&B and jazz album and earned his first Grammy nomination.

(Image credit: Ryder / @ryd.der)
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: How the West was won: K-pop's great assimilation gambit
item.description: The crossover hits stacking Grammy nods this year have little in common with the culture that birthed them — but they're winning the chart game.
item.content:encoded:
KPop Demon Hunters has secured nods in major Grammy categories and new height of visibility.'/>

The crossover hits stacking Grammy nods this year have little in common with the culture that birthed them — but they're winning the chart game.

(Image credit: Photos by Julian Song, John V. Esparza, Netflix)
item.dc:creator: Sheldon Pearce

item.title: Medicare Advantage insurers face new curbs on overcharges in Trump plan
item.description: Federal officials have a plan that could curb billions of dollars in overpayments to Medicare Advantage plans. But will they follow through on it?
item.content:encoded:
Federal officials have a plan that could curb billions of dollars in overpayments to Medicare Advantage plans. But will they follow through on it?

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Fred Schulte

item.title: Border czar says he plans to "draw down" ICE and CBP operations in Minnesota
item.description: Tom Homan, who took over leadership of the surge in Minneapolis, says he is working on a plan to reduce the force of federal agents in the Twin Cities.
item.content:encoded:
Tom Homan, who took over leadership of the surge in Minneapolis, says he is working on a plan to reduce the force of federal agents in the Twin Cities.

(Image credit: Scott Olson/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Senate to move ahead with spending deal but shutdown appears inevitable
item.description: Senate Democrats say they have a deal on the table to separate DHS funding from a package of five other appropriations bills. Once those bills are passed, they will have to once again be approved by the House.
item.content:encoded:
Senate Democrats say they have a deal on the table to separate DHS funding from a package of five other appropriations bills. Once those bills are passed, they will have to once again be approved by the House.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Why these women break the law to sell their eggs for IVF
item.description: Women in India were told they couldn't be paid for their eggs. The result: a black market for eggs from women in need of money to survive.
item.content:encoded:
Women in India were told they couldn't be paid for their eggs. The result: a black market for eggs from women in need of money to survive.

(Image credit: Diaa Hadid/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: DHS funding battle risks shutdown. And, Fed holds rates steady despite Trump pressure
item.description: Senate Democrats threaten a partial government shutdown over DHS funding. And, the Fed defies President Trump's pressure and holds rates steady to fight inflation.
item.content:encoded:
Senate Democrats threaten a partial government shutdown over DHS funding. And, the Fed defies President Trump's pressure and holds rates steady to fight inflation.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Saying Minnesota has 'been through a lot,' Klobuchar announces bid for governor
item.description: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar announced her run for Minnesota governor early Thursday. There is already a crowded field of Republicans in a race where immigration enforcement has become a key issue.
item.content:encoded:
Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar announced her run for Minnesota governor early Thursday. There is already a crowded field of Republicans in a race where immigration enforcement has become a key issue.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ellie Roth

item.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and players banned after African Cup final chaos
item.description: Africa's soccer body issued fines worth more than $1 million and banned Senegal's coach and Senegalese and Morocco players Wednesday following a shambolic African Cup soccer final this month.
item.content:encoded:
Africa's soccer body issued fines worth more than $1 million and banned Senegal's coach and Senegalese and Morocco players Wednesday following a shambolic African Cup soccer final this month.

(Image credit: Youssef Loulidi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
